name: JMichael Taylor
text:
Josh was helpful with info. I've driven 40 years with only one claim. Was not sure how to proceed with storm damage to my convertible top on my car.
These guys are friendly and helpful. Between my wife and I, we have been with State Farm for 30 years.

name: Matthew Eubanks
text: I couldn’t be more pleased with my recent dealings with Joshua and the entire staff at Bradberry! When they held my home insurance, they were always helpful. When I recently sold my home in Tuscaloosa, they guided me through a lengthy process to cancel my flood insurance through FEMA. They handled forms, inquiries, and information requests for me quickly, and they answered all my questions with ease. Even from 3 states away, they made the process effortless for me. I hated to leave them when I moved to another state. If ever back in Tuscaloosa, my first call will be to Bradberry for all my insurance needs!

name: Terre Currey
text:
We have been with Phil Bradberry for over 20 years and have been extremely pleased with every aspect of his business. His staff is knowledgeable and courteous. Phil is willing to take whatever amount of time you need to discuss coverage questions - investigate new policies - make sure your policy coverage is adequate.
I would highly recommend this agency to anyone.

name: Josetta Greene
text: Mr. Bradberry 's office resolve my  concerns in a matter of minutes. Ms. Amy help make my transition from ALFA to State Farm very easy. No waiting period ,coverage began before I could hang up the phone . I also received verification/proof within 5 minutes via email. GREAT SERVICE!!! You do not have to bring vehicle to office or sign in person...!!

name: Veena Bhargava
text: Before moving to Tuscaloosa, we contacted their office to transfer our State Farm policies.  We found the office staff extremely helpful, knowledgeable, and efficient.  After moving to Tuscaloosa, the office staff was very helpful in providing local references for various businesses.  We were very impressed by their customer service.

name: Jim Treacy
text: Philip and his staff are awesome!  Whenever we've had to file a claim or change status on any of our policies, they have been quick and handled every detail without us needing to worry about a thing.

name: Tabatha festa
text: Insurance is way to high i have already been told they rip people off big time. It doesnt cost them hardly anything to get this started. So the money they charge people most of that they stick in there pockets.

name: gerald melton
text: Failed a claim on my camper Phil and his team informed me that the damages wasn't covered. When getting the insurance was told anything that happens to the camper it would be covered it was a lie. Looking for new insurance company.

text: Daniel was able to get us a better price than we had been paying for YEARS with a competitor, and the coverage was better, too! He is always easy to reach when needed. Very professional but still very friendly. I would highly recommend him to anyone!

name: Jennifer Henning
text: As a Allstate customer I'm happy to say A Job Well Done To All Your Staff and Employees  EVERYWHERE   I Thank You  For keeping US all in Good Hands 👏👏👏👏👏👏👏👏

name: trudy edwards
text: I have been very satisfied with the professional conduct and the quick response from the staff at the agency. Everyone that I have spoke with has shown me that their insurance agents are trained to extend only the highest quality and valuable services to their clients.There is an agent ready to help without having to wait.Thank you Daniel and your staff.

name: Jerry Self
text:
My agent (Samuel Salter) has been helpful above and beyond expectations!! If you can, Clone him.
Honestly, he has always represented Allstate with patience and kindness while being helpful.
Thank you.

text: Daniel is the best Allstate Agent I've spoken with. He gave me excellent service on my Home and Auto policies, couldn't be more grateful to everything they've done. highly recommend.

name: Our New Path
text: Called to compare my current rates with some new ones I got from state farm. Called this office and had to leave a voicemail asking about discounted rates. Never heard back and then they just my coverage without a return phone call. Made the decision to switch fairly easy I guess.

name: SAYMILON GRIFFIN
text: Freda will go to bat for each and every one of her customers.  She has been in this line of business for awhile and knows exactly what to do.  Her experience in insurance needs is evident in how she treats her clients.  She understands how important protecting your assets are and will deliver.

name: Tom McClung
text: Being a new location just starting, I thought there may have been some issues with lack of training or customer service not up to my expectations. I could not have been more wrong. The staff along with Freda Anderson were extremely nice. I explained what I needed and they couldn't have been more helpful. Freda worked hand in hand with my rep Anna McClung and all of my insurance needs were met. I am waiting to sign my boat with them as soon as my other policy expires. I recommend them to everyone!!!

name: Melody Murray Zaragoza
text: Freda is an awesome insurance agent! Her staff are friendly and helpful. Freda does her best to cover your insurance needs.

name: Marie Eubanks
text: Not only do I recommend Freda to my clients but, she handles my family's insurance needs too!!  You won't find any better customer service!!!  Call her for a quote before you commit to any other company!!

name: Adam Hall
text: Freda is very helpful with all of your questions.  She goes the extra mile to help.  Would highly recommend her!

text: She is very knowledgeable. Able to meet me at a time that was convenient for me. Had all the information I needed.

text: I have had to file two claims recently: one auto and one home. I haven't had to file any claims in the past ten years or so I have had a policy. This local agency has done little to help even after promising I would get a phone call. Today the person I spoke with asked if I would wait until tomorrow for another person to come back.

text: My experience with Allstate, as a new policy holder of their auto and home insurance, has been worry free.  I must admit changing from the other company after 20 years was something I gave some thought, but I knew I needed to do it. Julie who walked me through the process was and is always helpful, quick to respond, and very knowledgeable. She went the extra mile to make sure the transition was a smooth one and made all documents availabe to me.  I highly recommend this agency and Allstate.  The savings for me are great and the excellent protection makes my move way past due.  I found the good hands of Allstate by way of the Lowe agency. Thinking of changing companies, consider the Lowe agency. Thank you Julie, James Lowe, and the entire Allstate company.

name: Michelle Rokavec
text: We were very unhappy with our current provider due to lack of communication and continued non-responsiveness, and decided we needed to make a change. After using the "esurance" site searching 'car insurance', we chose Allstate, and were contacted by them immediately. The agent we spoke with, Olivia, was fantastic! After taking down all the info, we had a detailed quote, with various coverage options, e-mailed to us within minutes. While talking with her the following day about these options, she patiently answered all our questions and clearly conveyed information. Because she was so professional, upbeat, and intelligent, we decided that this is exactly the type of person we wanted to work with. So, besides the car insurance, we decided to move ALL our insurance (Car, Home, and Wind) over to her at Allstate. Buying Insurance is a complex process and never actually 'fun', but it is far more pleasant if you are dealing with an agent and Agency you have confidence in! Thanks!

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback and support, Michelle. We’re so glad you’re having a great experience with our agency and staff.

text: I miss the days when Max Credit Union was Max Federal Credit Union. Back then you couldn't get an account unless you were military or related to someone with an account. Then they became a community credit union where anyone who lived in the tri-county could join. I guess that was good for expanding the business but they are a lot more crowded now. We've been customers for almost 30 years. They still offer very good services. Their accounts are still very reasonable and they are the first placed I'd go for a car loan.

name: Michael Hamilton
text:
We had a terrible experience with Allstate and the Bryan Sheffield agency did nothing to help.   I have been a customer of this agency (policies including homeowner’s, multiple autos, and a boat) for approximately 5 years.  I had a claim due to a flash flood damaging a vehicle.  The claim process was a nightmare, mostly due to working with virtual/out-of-state adjusters (something Bryan’s agency was apparently unaware of).

It took over a month to get the claim settled - currently on day 34 and the claim is still open.  The car was eventually totaled on day 22, but later Allstate decided they would rescind that decision and repair it (after I had purchased a replacement).  Later, they changed again and totaled it.

On day 13, I emailed the office manager and asked that Bryan call me.  I understand the agency does not directly deal with claims, but they can assist and advise where necessary, especially when the process is a bad experience for their customers.  Instead, his office manager called me, provided no assistance, and seemed surprised that Allstate does not have auto adjusters in Birmingham (where this agency is selling auto policies).

According to the multiple solicitation emails I receive weekly, customer service is very important to this agency.  I have emailed Bryan three times and asked that he call me as stated above.  As of today (day 34), Bryan has not called nor contacted me outside of solicitation emails trying to sell me additional products and services.

I eventually had to file a formal Department of Insurance complaint against the company and the agency.  If you make the mistake of choosing Allstate as your insurer, I would highly recommend finding a different agent.

name: Etta Lea
text: I switched my auto and homeowners over to Lokey a couple of weeks ago. Even though they didn't honor the pricing in their marketing solicitation (hello, bait & switch), I still signed up as I liked the idea of working with a locally-owned agent. After I had cancelled my policies with Geico & Liberty Mutual, I was notified by mail that the Allstate homeowners policy written by Lokey was cancelled. I called Dakota at Lokey in a panic, he indicated that I still had a few days before the cancellation would take effect. He said he would look into the issue and call me back. He never called me back, I had to call him a few days later.  Once again he said he would call me back, but I had to call him back again. He then informed me that because of a zero-payment claim and another minor claim that I can't verify, the only coverage I could get was going to be twice as much as I had been paying with my previous Liberty Mutual policy . Which I had cancelled, because (I thought) I had the new insurance from Lokey/Allstate! I truly regret that I ever responded to that marketing email from Lokey. Dealing with this has been a nightmare.

resp.text: Im very sorry that you had a bad experience. I will be happy to call you tomorrow to discuss.

Highly recommend Dakota Parrish at Lokey Allstate.

It’s sad that you can never talk to someone in billing and it’s also sad that the agents always say they will call you back and never do. name: Greg Watson
text:
I have been mailing Michelle for several months now to let her know that she has been sending me details of someone else’s account. I live and work in Scotland, and have never been a customer of Allstate.

All of these emails have gone unanswered which - having worked in financial services at a senior level myself for over 20 years - astounds me at the level of disdain being taken with a customer’s data.

I hope that this review, which I was asked to provide by Allstate,  will finally prompt some action on Michelle / Allstate’s part so that the Greg Watson they’re trying to contact is no longer having his financial circumstances communicated to some random from the other side of the planet.

name: Lorraine Price
text:
They called to offer me a quote on car insurance. I thought, why not? It was half the price of my progressive quote on my latest vehicle. The downside is that it still takes about an hour to sign papers and leave. The upside is that I received quite a few gifts just for signing up. I got a plastic key chain, a magic jar opener (rubber gripper), a tire pressure key fob, chapstick, hand sanitizer, and a  20 oz. stainless steel mug. My agent, Derek, also gave me tips on how to save money on groceries and meat, and movies.
He cared and showed concern for my budget.

resp.text: Lorraine, thank you for taking the time to leave such a positive review and kind words. We are happy to serve you with all of your insurance needs!

name: David Williamson
text:
I've  had State Farm insurance for 50 years.  Never been disappointed.  For the last several years Pam Marbut has been my agent.  I couldn't be any more pleased.  She has been more like a friend.  She looks after the needs of my family very well.  She sold me universal life policies when each of my grandchildren were born,  Two of them are now using money from  those policies to help pay college tuition.  I have car, life and home covered with State Farm.  Pam has shown me all the ways those policies can work best for me. I  have some amazing experiences from working with Pam. Getting close to the end of my life but have no doubt State Farm with take me to the end.  Thanks State Farm and thank you Pam.
David Williamson

name: Brittany Brown
text:
Update time! I've been with Wendy Burpee for I think two years now? Maybe more! Everyone at this branch is a DREAM. They are SO sweet, so willing to go out of their way to save me a dollar on my plan, that I can't imagine switching for life.

As I learned recently, State Farm is a mutual company (no shareholders), which is a different type of insurance than many other companies, and it absolutely shows in the pricing and the customer experience. It's like the credit union version of insurance (I think! I'm still new to the concept). I know not everyone will get the lower price, but if you haven't tried, seriously give these ladies a call.

OLD review: I'll be honest - I haven't met the agent, and I haven't spoken to anyone in the office at length. But to me, this simply speaks of the efficiency this office is working at. If I have an issue, boom, done by the front desk. Taken care of. Five minutes or less. Need to make an extra payment? Need to change your plan? Need anything? Sure, her team gets it done. They seem pretty courteous in the blips of chats we've had, so I assume they must be pretty solid. Best insurance I've had so far.

resp.text: Oh wow. Brittany! You made our day. I am so glad it shows that making it easy for people to do business with us at the best value we can provide is what we are striving to do. We want every interaction to be an experience that brightens your day a little. Thank you so much for taking the time for such a thorough review!

name: Marvin Barnes
text: (Bait and switch) I was quoted a certain rate for homeowners insurance on my rental property. I paid the periumum in full for the year.  Then about 3 months later, I was charged more without explanation. So far, the auto and primary homeowners insurance premiums have been as quoted, but it has only been about 6 months.

resp.text:
Mr. Barnes,
Thank you for your feedback. We do appreciate your business. To address your comment that we did a bait and switch, we simply do not do that. Upon further investigation of your comment, I found out that the property is a duplex. We were never told that it was a duplex when we did the initial quote. Every risk is different in some way, it is vitally important that we know everything and disclose everything or it could cause you a problem in the event of a claim. If you feel that this is an error, please call my office and we will be glad to sit down and review the information. I would appreciate it if you would consider revising your score as this is reflection upon our agency. My family has been associated with Allstate for 55 years and we did not get there by misleading our customers.

name: Dianna Gore
text: HOW DO I FEEL ...... NOT GOOD! My experience IS NOT OVER. AND it appears my claim has been closed! My camper trailer was damaged during Hurricane Sally. It' going to cost close to $5,000.00 to get it totally repaired and the adjuster gave an estimate of $3,700.00??? I have pictures to show the gouge in the side of my camper, it goes all the way through to the inside wall. He thinks the materials will cost $144.00???? It's really going to cost around $550.00!! I've been an Allstate customer for over 50 years .......I AM NOT ONE BIT HAPPY. And on top of that, I've received no phone calls from Pete Russell's office, only emails. After 50 years I would expect a little more from my agent!

name: Anna Bryant
text: These guys do a great job. They are always available and patient! Thank you!!!

name: Andrew Davis
text: My wife was in a bad car accident in the fall of 2017 where she was rear ended while coming to a stop by someone at about 50-55mph. The driver that hit her had the state minimum limit ($25K) and my wife’s medical bills exceeded that amount so we filed an underinsured  motorist claim with Allstate foolishly assuming they would pay the claim since we had the coverage and had been paying for it. It’s now over two years later and we are in court with Allstate because they refused to pay our claim. They have probably spent more in legal bills than the $25K limit we have. We have underinsured motorist coverage for this exact type of issue and our own insurance company is going out of their way to not help their own insured. Add to this, at no time have we gotten a call from our agent to ask if there was anything we needed or to even check on my wife. I would in no way recommend Allstate.

name: Jason Wright
text: WORST INSURANCE EXPERIENCE EVER!!!! GIVING 1 STAR ONLY BECAUSE 0 STARS IS NOT AN OPTION! We were solid paying customers and paid 6 months in advance the entire time we had the policy. My wife and I just merged bank accounts...so we contacted our agent and had the account switched to the merged account since we were planning to close the other one out... Allstate told us it was taken care of. Not True! - So we realized something was wrong when we got a notice (which was the 1st notice we had received) stating that our policy coverage had been terminated because of failure to make payment. We called the agent office and informed them that we had received the notice and apparently the amount of time it takes for the bank account changes to take place didn't kick it into effect until they had already tried to auto draft the payment from the wrong account and therefore instead of calling us to let us know, they just sent us a letter after the policy was terminated. So at this point I called to discuss with an agent on the Friday when we found out to see what could be done  because we were supposed to be going out of town and currently had no insurance coverage... I spoke with a very polite office admin in which I asked her to see if there was anything that could be done.... in which she obliged but she informed us that she would need to call the underwriter and make sure they were going to reinstate the policy, which we didn't think would be an issue because we had not had any accidents/accident claims while we had been under the related policy. So we get a call back about 2 hours later that the underwriter was not going to reinstate the policy because during the term of the coverage, my wife had made a claim to have a cracked windshield replaced in which she asked the agent before making the claim and was told that it would not go against us in regards to our policy or premium because it was part of what was covered under the policy that we were paying for. We asked them to see if there was a manager or agency owner that could do anything to correct the situation but apparently our local office manager was on vacation and the other branch managers that were supposedly contacted either weren't really contacted or didn't care because we were never contacted again and ended up having to find a new insurance coverage through a different agency. This was probably the worst I have ever been treated from a customer service standpoint in consideration that we are always good prompt paying customers and the fact that our bill not getting auto-drafted was attributed to Allstate's screw-up and then we weren't notified until our policy had already been cancelled and then they used the most petty excuse to not re-instate our policy. I would not recommend Allstate to anyone...ever.

text: BLUF: Nagging sales people and substandard insurance. When I was in my 30's they called me at least once a month trying to upsell me on their mediocre product. There are better options available, my advice is go and find one.

name: Daniel Scott
text: Selected this company because of their relationship with Costco. I nonetheless would not recommend appling for term life insurance with Protective. It ended up being a waste of time. The lab work from my medical exam all came back as a healthy 30 year old. The claim was denied based on a rash on my leg. This is even after the dermatologist stated there were no health risks with the condition. I can only assume that a health professional was not involved in the underwriting process.  For as much as I enjoy Costco, this is a company/service they should drop.

name: No Never
text: My dad died in 2005 and my family has sent them death certificates talked to them and sent back forms they requested and they will not release his money back to us.  The continually send us a bill for $10.00 and when we do not send the $10.00, they take the $4,400 he paid in and pay the monthly premium.  Every time we call we get some excuse and a request for new forms. Good luck with this company, I have filed a complaint to get our family money that is ours.

resp.text: Robert, I would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you. If you would like, please email us at social.media@protective.com and we’ll reach out to you directly. Thank you! -RH

name: Brian w
text:
My mother purchased a prepaid life insurance policy with liberty mutual years ago. She passed in June of this year I called liberty mutual and was informed that I had to call protective insurance. I called and was told how to file a claim which I did following their instructions. I did not get any response from the company so I called them they said they would have a rep call me back we’ll I never got a call instead I got an email stating my mother’s death certificate had status of divorced and I had to provide them a copy of the divorce decree. I checked with the county clerks office in Erie county New York and was told that those records are sealed pursuant to New York State law and that the only people that can view them are the plaintiff,defendant or attorneys of record so I called protective back and was told someone would call me back. SUPRISE no call back again so I called again and asked to speak with a supervisor and I was connected to John who stated he would look into it and call me back the next day. Guess what no call back again. I called them again and after being put on hold was told that everything was ok and I didn’t need to do anything  After another week went by I called to check the status of my claim and was told I had to provide a copy of my parents divorce decree I explained again that I could not provide it because my parents divorced 49 years ago and were no longer alive my father passed years before my mother took out the policy. I was told I needed to provide a copy of my fathers death certificate in order for them to process my claim. By the way did I mention I am listed as the sole beneficiary on the policy.... I should not have to provide anything but my mother’s death certificate which I did in the first place. I just faxed a copy of my fathers death certificate today let’s see what excuse they come up with next not to pay on my claim. I will probably have to sue them for what is rightfully mine left to me by my late mother. This company should be ASHAMED

Update
Protective insurance got back to me to make sure the claim was closed and they listened to my concerns and stated that they would try to improve their call backs moving forward. I am impressed that they followed up with me on my concerns I wish they would have done it sooner if they had I never would have had to make this post in the first place. But it all worked out in the end. Thank you protective

resp.text: Brian, I’m sorry for your experience and would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you. If you would like, please email us at social.media@protective.com and we’ll reach out to you directly. -RH

text: Horrible Customer Service. 35 min call on my break at work with no help..agent could not answer my questions. The second person came to the phone sounding aggravated that I called asking about my policy...so long for good customer service. 😣

name: Cita Philpot
text: My mother lost her daughter, my sister on November 25, 2018. The insurance agent filed a claimed in December along with the death certificate, it’s now February and all they keep telling us is their processing it. Honestly, this is absolutely unacceptable and very unprofessional. Hopefully they can handle this matter promptly and in a timely manner before we seek other measures!

resp.text: Good Afternoon Cita.  We are so sorry for your family’s loss and apologize for the inconvenience.  We would appreciate the opportunity to speak with you and resolve this issue. Please reach out to us at 1-800-424-1592. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. - RH

name: mika mikar
text: WORST EXPERIENCE EVER! Do not deal with this company! Your loved one will be dead and buried and you will still be fighting with Protective Life. Just added grief, stress, and loss of funds.

resp.text: Hi Mika. I'm sorry for the experience you've had and we would appreciate the opportunity to help. If you'd like, email us at social.media@protective.com and we can have someone reach out to you directly. - RH

name: Rebekah Bliss
text: Worst experience with this company. Don’t even consider them.

name: Legend Hodges
text: This is Heather Hodges. My grandmother bought policy's when my siblings and I were born. My brother and I decided to surrender our policies due to the fact that I recently had my first child and need a car to get him to appointments and I to work. My brother did his first and had his money in a month I then began my surrender at the end of July and was told they had to decide if my grandma or me wasbtge owner which it states on the policy when we turn 18 it's ours. I'm 31 now. So after that delaying the process I email my paperwork to them on Sept 23 and it's only supposed to take up to 10 days. It's over that and all they can tell me is they will put a request in...well obviously that's what I already did. I just don't get why it takes so long to surrender it isn't like someone died and u had to investigate and it isn't a large sum of money. Started in July it's now Oct n nothing.

resp.text: Hi Heather. I’m sorry for your experience and would appreciate the opportunity to help. If you would like, please email us at social.media@protective.com and we’ll be able to reach out to you directly. -RH

name: Lloyd Brown
text: Their telephone system is atrocious.  The voice recognition system doesn't work. If you do get the numeric input to work be prepared for a long wait, a very long wait. If you do get to talk to someone be prepared for another long wait if they must access any information from their computer system.

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know about this issue with our telephone system, and we’re so sorry for your experience. Protective is constantly looking for areas to improve and will pass your feedback on to our operations teams. Hopefully with constructive feedback like yours, we can streamline the process for all of our clients. -AP

name: Cece P
text:
This company is horrific. The left hand doesn’t know what the right hand is doing. They keep telling me my account is in grace period but yet I just paid my account. Don’t even try the 1-800 number so dang many prompts you get dizzy then I was on hold 45 minutes.

Then I called the 205 number and was told something totally different from my first call on May 17.

Oh yeah in the letter they sai “ you may want to take a moment to consider the reasons you originally purchased this insurance” personally I found this statement aggorant and condescending. So now I’m off to find some else. To bad I’ve had this policy since 1992

resp.text: Hello Cece -- We apologize if there has been any incorrect information provided and would very much like to help with this matter. Please email social.media@protective.com and someone will follow up with any questions or concerns you have. -RH

name: Elsie Fletcher
text: Agree with the poor reviews.  I inherited an account from my Dad and decided to leave it with the company for 5 years.  My calculations show they owed me around $51,000; they paid me $49,000; and when I called for a breakdown of principal vs earnings they sent me a form saying they issued me a check for $46,000!  Needless to say I called and they will have a processor call me back- in the next 8-10 business days. Totally unacceptable - am drafting a letter for Richard Bielen, President and CEO.  This is after struggling with them for 6 months to determine how to handle my account - I was told I could roll to an annuity; then I was told by someone else I could not.........  The reps seem nice but either uninformed or overworked.  I see they are in a partnership with Costco and I will voice my concern to them also.  I also see there are NO women on their corporate board so I am disappointed my Dad invested with them as the Father of three successful daughters!

resp.text: Hello Elise -- We apologize if there has been any incorrect information sent to you and would very much like to help with this matter. Please email social.media@protective.com and someone will follow up with any questions or concerns you have. -RH

text: Insured Nomads offers top quality travel & medical insurance for digital nomads, world travelers, and expats. They offer up to $1,000,000 for medical bills with zero deductibles and you can get insured while in a foreign country unlike other competitors. You can also make a donation for a good cause to the non-profit Not For Sale. It’s better to be safe than sorry. Do yourself a favor and sign up for Insured Nomads!

text: Brad was my agent for 6 years. Started with car insurance, then renters insurance, homeowners insurance, and then my landlord insurance. text: About a month ago, a deer ran out from the mountainside in our neighborhood and hit the side of my car, damaging both of the passenger side doors and knocking out one of the windows. Your staff is so calming and knowledgeable and assisted us with how to file the claim, what to expect during the process and in general just let us that they were there for us.  That type of service certainly goes a long way in pleasing the customer.  Thank you so very much for your excellent service!

text: Allstate Insurance Agent Brad Johnson is a one a kind Insurance Agent.  He is very thorough with answering any insurance questions needs. He did not just close the door and say, “We cannot help you.” He took out the time to provide the best options for my insurance needs.  When an Insurance Agent is trying to help you and you do not even have a policy in place just yet, speaks volumes to me.  Let’s just say I had a better understanding regarding insurance coverage's that I never knew about before.  After speaking with Brad, I acknowledged that he had the best interest for me and my family.  I am now an Allstate Insurance client.  YAY!  I have already had to file claims.  Brad and his team have been tremendous with helping me file my insurance claims and getting them processed.  Brad’s knowledge base, welcoming approach, great customer service, professionalism, willingness to execute the best plans for customers is why I highly recommend Brad Johnson and his team to help you with your insurance coverage needs.

Maybe if I claim to want to open a new policy someone will answer the phone (seeing as that's the last time I could get in touch with anyone).

name: victor jolley
text:
So, after 7 years of great service, I no longer want to do business with this agency. They bumped my auto liability to HALF A MILLION DOLLARS back in November. They have dodged, made excuses, etc etc. and still wouldn't take it off. I imagine they will make further excuses after reading this. Tried to cancel policy, but when I call, they put me on hold, then i get hung up on after about 5 min. I put a stop payment on this last bill for the exact amount, which is required to stop the payment. What did they do? After bank stopped the draft, Wiggins agency dropped the amount down, after 6 months of fighting, to original pre half million dollar amount. Then ran it through again! Went through, of course, because it was a diff amount. So now, in addition to being overcharged since November, they have now taken money on insurance I no longer want. I want this money back now, and I want my overcharged money back for the last 6 months!
And I loved these guys. All this because somebody decided to Jack up my policy, then give me the run around on correcting it. SMH.

name: Bonnie Sendejo
text: Michelle Chapin set up my policy and set it up incorrectly. When I responded to an email to inform her of this she ignored me. Then I was charged twice and set up with 2 policies. When I emailed her again directly I was ignored. She finally responded when I sent an email to Craig letting him know my experience with her. I emailed her 3 times asking about a refund and she has yet to respond. I had to call the 800 number to get assistance and was told my over payment was not refunded as I had asked but applied to other policy. The 800 number was able to correct this while I still have be ignored. I would not recommend this office.

resp.text: I understand your concerns and want you to know that we are here to help in any possible way. Please call us at 256-881-1100 or feel free to email me directly at joseph@wigginsagency.com. Thank you so much.

Both staff members to whom I spoke (Nina & Beth), had willing and flexible attitudes while answering my many questions, explaining the advantages of the driving history our long relationship with Allstate provided, and entertaining the special payment options I requested. My family is looking forward to dealing with them over the long term.

resp.text:
Hi, Darlene! There are many factors that determine the rate of your policy, including driving history, marital status, vehicle type and more. Our agents are trained to search for all applicable savings and discounts, but are always happy to conduct a policy review to ensure we've maximized your savings. If that's something you're interested in, please email DAFeedback@directauto.com with your full name, address, date of birth, policy number and contact number. We look forward to hearing from you soon and thank you for being a customer of Direct Auto. Have a wonderful day!

Direct Auto Insurance
Feedback@DirectAuto.com | DirectAuto.com
(877) 463-4732

text: Overall it's a good agent.  However , I had told the Agent that this house is under major renovation. Someone came out and did an inspection. I had it repaired by the date and informed the Agent. I even sent  photos . About a week later I was notified that my policy was cancelled. I had to contact the Agent to get it straightened out. Seems like a lack of communication between the underwriters and the Agent.

name: Sherrie Campbell
text: The visit was a pleasant one. Went with my mom to get wind coverage for her home. The person who waited on us was nice and pleasant. The only thing that gave me cause for pause was the fact that the coverage for items in the home was only covered at 50% of that for the structure as opposed to the 75% that every other company offered. This concerned me. She even asked me/us was that enough. I mentioned that the coverage from Allstate was a greater % based on structural coverage. However, no greater coverage was offered. Otherwise, all went well. As you can see, I've still not come to terms with the 50%, but we paid for the year in full. It's a done deal now... she was nice, but the coverage isn't ideal...

text: Very satisfied with my experience here!  Extremely friendly office with knowledgeable staff.  I had been with my previous insurance agency for over 25 years and was not planning to make any changes, as I had not had any previous problems.  However, after discussing my policy and coverage and reviewing details as they specifically pertained to my needs, I realized that was underinsured in liability limits and needed additional coverage.  I am now protected for all worst case scenarios.  Made the change that day and also saved money!  Highly recommend.

name: mekeiawatson
text: I met with Lyndsey to obtain my insurance. I left the office after paying my down payment WITH insurance binder in hand, which told me that I was to be paying one price every month. I get a bill from State Farm and it is $77 MORE than the auto binder Lyndsey handed me. I tried to call Lyndsey, and I was promised a phone call back because she was busy. Hey, it happens. I'm busy with a life, too. But after waiting all day and the next day with no return call, I figured I'd just call customer relations. They couldn't even tell me why she gave me a binder with one price and I receive a bill with another price. So, CR put me in contact with this agency.  The little witch AT THE AGENCY (I can't remember her name) who was supposed to be helping me, HUNG UP IN MY FACE!!  I refuse to pay AND beg someone, too. I have been with State Farm before and never have I felt like a second hand citizen like I have by this agency these past couple of days. The competition in the insurance business is too great for anyone to take my money and mistreat me. Just signed up with another insurance company TODAY!!

resp.text: Mekeia, We are so sorry for the experience you had. We strive hard to take care of our customers every day and take it seriously if we ever fall short.

name: Erin Defelippo
text: I was happy at first. Don't get me wrong. First I was dealing with a girl that we will call C. She was sweet. She helped me start up my policy and because I was alone on this, I was new to everything. She assured me that everything would be okay and that things would work out and they did.....for a while. My bill fluctuated so much and at one point they managed to withdraw from my account twice with in a three month range and overdraft my bank account, see C knew I wouldn't have the funds for this stuff until a certain date and I was told by another rep at this office that  my stuff couldn't be withdrawn from my account on the day that I wanted. It had to be there way. I never saw, spoke to, or emailed with the representative in this office "Rebekah brown" instead I was shuffled over to another agent we will call her L. L took care of most of my stuff and because I didn't want the automatic withdraw she decided that it was OKAY for me to call in and make my payments. On the last day dealing with this particular office, I dealt with another agent and by then I had enough. I told this agent "I do not want to speak to you do not call me back, I do not wish to deal with you, I am not going over anything with you." and this was because SHE wanted to change everything in my policy or do this and do that and this and that. All I wanted to know was WHY I was being charged 100$ more than what I was being charged the first go around. Now because of this office I AM WORKING with another agent and trying to UNWIND all the mess that was created by this office. It has been an absolute disaster. Here I am 3 months out from this agency and the new Agent is STILL cleaning up the mess created. Heck, at least I know who I am dealing with because they actually interface with their people, don't switch their people from agent to agent, and actually RETURN phone calls when they say they're going to call back. - Moral of the story - You want a faceless Rep? Go to this agency. Want someone who messes up the policy's and manages to make you pay for it all in one fell swoop? This is the one for you!

name: GNice
text:
Complete waste of time, called to get a quote at 2:30pm on 5/21 and agent says he will contact me no later than 10am the next day and no call back received so I call around lunch time receptionist says he's out to lunch so I finally get a call back around 3pm telling me they can't beat my current rate because one of their software programs they use is showing I had 2 accidents on my record which was untrue because I've never had a wreck in my life.

I call my current insurance provider who I was insured with at the time of these supposid accidents and guess what? They don't have a record of them either and neither does my local DMV.

The agent was really nice but my god if your using software that gives you obvious incorrect information and your using that information to provide potential customers quotes..i would suggest investing into an alternative.

resp.text: Hello Greg, we are truly sorry to hear about your struggle concerning your auto quote. Insurance can be complicated enough, and we recognize the frustration of an undesirable outcome. We strive to provide the highest quality of service in every interaction with our customers and take any discontent very seriously. Our CEO has reached out and left his personal contact information in order to rectify this situation. We hope to hear back from you.

name: Adam Karsten
text:
I have always used Geico and Progressive for my automotive insurance needs, but recently I was contacted by an agent from this office named Matthew Tompkins. I have never utilized State Farm before, and did some research and found great experiences from numerous people.

I was immediately blown away by the quick and consistent responses from Matthew. He made me feel like I was his only customer, and it was refreshing getting to deal with a local agent rather than the remote 800 number services I was accustomed to.

I had them do a quote, and was greatly surprised at the amount of coverages I could get for home and auto.  Pricing was very competitive, and I was able to obtain extraordinary coverages, along with umbrella, and discovered they can provide coverages for my business as well.

Thus far, I've had a great experience and would encourage others to consider using this office for your insurance needs if you're in Baldwin County. This group seems to truly care about taking care of you and getting you set up with what you want for a reasonable price.

Highly recommended!

Good morning Josh!  First, let me say that I am disappointed in your response and would love the opportunity to discuss your dissatisfaction in greater depth.  Please note that the issue that you are referring to occurred prior to your policy being transferred over to my agency.  My office has done everything we can possibly to do help, but our hands are tied given what has transpired over the months prior to your policy transitioning over to my agency.

We absolutely want to help and I ask that you contact me directly at 256-350-8660 to further discuss your review if interested.  Helping our customers is our top priority and our track record clearly portrays that.

Went there a second time to re-cancel and make sure they stop taking money of my account and now they just text me my payment its due in 5 days. I dare them to go ahead a take another payment of my account. Refund?! Sit, wait and pray. Don't recommend this company!

text:
Purchased 2015 Transit 150 XLT constant complaints to Ford and Dealer concerning vibrations over a nation wide recall of those vans built in Kentucky till this day no fix has been made to resolve this issue. Treatment from service team is not one of the expectation that you’ll be taken care of.  No response!!! Your always own your own. Now that the van is there for two months I have tor remind them to fix the other recall.and why should I have to ? They should have that information.
Check all recalls !!! If not your loss .. they will make sure you don’t get the fix that is required for the problem.  40,000 later in the cost of the van and it drives like its over The St  Andreas fault !!!
Never mind to buy here again. Ford let me down and my Dealer also
The ford customer service is now handle by reps in the Philippines and they give you more of a hard time. What’s sad is. Ford was once a American to the roots vehicle . Now it’s just a another way to make a dime ... good luck with your purchase. I wouldn’t wish this on my worst enemy.

name: Joshua Rogers
text:
This is a review of the service and quick oil change of Long-Lewis.

I had my 150 Raptor serviced there and stayed with the truck just because I didn’t feel like going to the waiting area.  The did change the oil on time as scheduled but they did not 80% of the check list they gave me.

I figured I would give them another try so the next oil change I had done I did go in the waiting area. There was an older lady working and she was not helpful. She seemed to make everyone feel like they were bothering her by asking basic questions. Also the manager there was yelling at another employee and even tried to talk to me about how he was unhappy with the management at Long-Lewis.

Today, I went in for a safety recall and they were again unwelcoming and told me I would need to wait a few weeks to get it done even though the job takes about an hour according to the service personnel.  In my mind if the Ford motor company issues a safety recall then it needs to be addressed sooner than later.  I did offer to leave the truck there and they could fit it but they still said no.

It’s unlikely I will do further business there and that’s unfortunate because I will likely be buying 2 expensive vehicles this year and would be potential life long customer since I’m local.

I left messages etc. It was returned to me on 02/18/19. I drove it a few miles.. ENGINE FAULT LIGHT COMES ON. Tach is all over the place. it doesn't want to pull etc.. this is the latest problem...SO NOW LONG LEWIS SAYS BRING US YOUR CAR... and if need be WE WILL GIVE YOU A LOANER.. I SAID NO. text: Although I have never made a major claim, my experience with Cody Coffey's team has always been pleasant and stress free. They explain things clearly, are always friendly, and communicate in a timely and effective manner.

name: Shane Medley
text: Horrible experience upon cancellation. Insurance premium on homeowners kept going up every renewal. More than double within 2 years. There excuse was cost to build the home more than double every year. But this isn't the bad part because upon cancellation they required my new insurance company to forward them proof of homeowners and auto and if not done they refused to cancelled my current policy with them. After doing this they then dropped and I thought it was done. They have sent multiple letters to my home loan lender stating no insurance and this was bad enough. Now after a month of proving I never lapsed I get a letter again stating I haven't had auto for over 2 months and they are charging me back charges due to Allstate: Cody Coffey in Centre telling them with multiple letters that my insurance was cancelled and there was no current insurance. Now I am having to write a letter, send in by email, mail, fax, online proof along with my current provider doing the same thing and proving I had this as of day of cancellation. Then to top it off they stated they cancelled me in the letters when I clearly have all proof also that I cancelled. They make it extremely difficult if you leave. I never again will go with these people I don't care how much money I can save. Very HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! They sucker you in on price with homeowners then jack it up where its more than anyone. Outrageous. They told me when I informed them I would be searching that everyone's rate was going up like this due to the insurance commissioner forcing it. I found this was a complete lie among every provider I spoke with.

resp.text: I am sorry that you had a bad experience with us, I can assure you that it will not happen again. Please give us a call and we will correct our mistake 100%, thank you!

name: Sylvia New
text: We changed over in March of 2015  from another company and one of our vehicles was entered as a 2003 instead of 2000 and when we went to purchase our tag this year (2016) we found out that our tag had been suspended for lack of insurance.  The agent told us that we were the ones in fault because we should have read our cards better.  We were to trustworthy of the agency staff so we are facing the consequences of this.  We ask for a correction but was told by the worker it was not her fault and she would not do anything.  We have contacted the Headquarters.  Just know that we did try to contact Cody Coffey but they would not share his contact information so as of right now he may not know about this problem we have faced because of his worker in the office.

resp.text: Dear Sylvia,  I am sorry that you had a bad experience with us, I can assure you that it will not happen again. Please give us a call and we will correct our mistake 100%, thank you!

name: Val Porter Cook
text: You know, you often call on your insurance agency when something goes wrong. When something goes wrong, the last thing you want to do is talk to a company. You want to talk to a person. In the 25 years of my adult life that I've been with AllState -- through car accidents, home floods, one marriage, two children, losing my father to cancer, and supporting my husband through cancer -- I call, and I get a friendly voice...not a corporate line. They have been thought partners with me on how to handle crisis.  I feel sorry for my friends who have to fight against their insurance companies through tough times; mine fights with me.  Thanks, AllState

text: Allstate was an okay company to have auto insurance with. I cancelled for cheaper insurance through someone else. I was confused as to why my policy stated a certain amount due and called Delores to cancel and question that. Delores stated I had already been cancelled and refused to explain why and just insisted on telling me I haven’t paid in two months when I had indeed paid. I tried to send screenshots of bank statements and she stated I have already explained this to you, very rudely and stated the payments didn’t go thru. She didn’t care to hear anything I said nor did she care to explain anything further. I checked the Allstate app after getting off the phone with Delores and the amount owed MYSTERIOUSLY changed and it finally showed the policy was cancelled on the date I called, not before. I’ll give this Allstate three stars because aside from dealing with unprofessional staff, the insurance was good and I did however speak with Alice, whom was sweet and went over everything with me. Although no one cared to acknowledge Delores wrongs, Alice had a much better attitude and was much more professional.

text:
I was quoted a price with a multi-car discount when I don't have more than one car and was never told that was part of the price. I never indicated it either since, obviously, I don't have more than one car. The price was used to get me in the door. What is worse, when my bill went up, the agency wouldn't do anything about it. Basic customer service would have been covering the cost(Only $100 over 3 months) and then at renewal, let me decide if I find the price acceptable. They couldn't even do that. I will swap to literally ANY insurance that gives me SAME price or less at renewal just as a matter of principal. They lost $1000 every 6 months over $100.

The lady I spoke too who helped me discover why was very nice and I felt she personally has good customer service.

name: Jonathan Adams
text:
Tim Roberts and his team are a great group of people to work with.  Tim takes the time to understand your needs and goals; not just push a policy.  Even if you can save a few dollars per month with another company it is not worth the piece of mind that comes with Tim.  Like I've told him since I moved to Huntsville; "I feel like you have my back."  His Agency proved this earlier this year when my wife was hit by someone who ran a red light.  I was in Muscle Shoals so I called Tim to help.  His son Jordan immediately came to help and even though we did not have to make a claim on our end, Tim and his team walked us through every part of the process.  Even called the other insurance agency who was trying to drag their feet, (we had a rental car for 6 months...).  I expect high quality when I pay for a service and have never been let down, again, if you want an insurance company who looks at you as more than a number this is the Agency to choose.

- Jonathan Adams

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words and great review Jonathan! We are so glad to hear how positive your experience has been. Thank you for putting your trust in us, we are so thankful for customers like you!

name: Steven Ogran
text: Henry and team have been handling my insurance needs (home, auto, and life) for over 10 years.  Like many, I was with a branded firm for a while, and had what I thought were decent rates.  But, loyalty is a two-way street and when rate-hikes happen there's no one else to run to when you don't have a broker.  Red Rock has connections with MANY insurance companies and are able to shop around, find the best fit for their customer, and secure AMAZING rates.  I have had probably a dozen friends join the Red Rock family and NO ONE was let down.  Give them a try, I know its hard to leave the place you've been for so long but to save money and have a solution that fits you like a glove is worth it.  Red Rock makes it so easy as well.  Customer for life!

name: Curtis Simon
text: Before moving, a friend referred John Lipscomb to see if he could save me some money on my néw home.  Wow is all I can say.  His quote came in at almost half of what I received from my current insurance agency. Highly recommend!

name: Patrick Bloom
text: We have been extremely pleased with Red Rock Insurance since switching from AllState (which we had over 20yrs). Red Rock was a few dollars higher on our homeowners insurance, but nearly cut our auto insurance bill in half from what we were paying. Unfortunately, we have had a few claims since switching (car accident, storm damage to home, and car vs deer) but Red Rock handled each claim quickly and thoroughly, keeping us informed each step of the way. It's nice to have an agent that we can actually talk to, instead of an automated phone system. We couldn't be happier with Red Rock, and will continue to recommend them, as we have many times already.

resp.text: Patrick, thanks for your kind words!  We value your relationship and your business!

name: John Smith
text: I have been very satisfied with the service that I have received from Henry, Natalie and Maria at Red Rock. text: Henry and Red Rock continue to exceed expectations. We purchased a new vehicle and with minimal effort Henry had us taken care of. Exceptional service! We most recently had a fire at our house. Henry provided all of the claim information and information for Servpro. He also called servpro to let them know that I would be calling to help speed up the process. Red Rock isn't a 1800 number and they definitely exceed expectations every time!

text: My experience with Redrock was great. I told Charlie what I was looking for and a few days later he got back with me with a quote that had great coverage at a price I was very happy with. I was closing on my house and he took care of getting all of the info to my lender. It was a pain-free process, 5 stars!

name: Andrea Higginbotham
text: They provided good service and found the best rates for the coverage I needed.  Compared to the rates over other competitors they were much better.

name: Tom Chapman
text: I trust Henry and Natalie fully and know they always have my family's best interest in mind. I have never felt the need to question their recommendation or "shop around" because they always present me with the best possible option.

name: Sallie Hallmark
text: Red Rock Insurance is dependable and efficient. They shopped my insurance to save me money AND get me better coverage. Have been a customer for five years. Highly recommend!

name: Maxine Burns
text: I could copy and paste  Shunte Moore's review because my experience is pretty much what she said.  When I started with Red Rock Natalie was there and I felt like I had an agent, but now when I call most times the phone does not even ring, it just disconnects!  Hard to reach, and slow or not response is the new normal at Red Rock. I'm looking elsewhere - there has to be more customer friendly insurance agencies out there.

resp.text: Maxine,  we are in the process of transitioning phone systems to a better and more robust system that will provide a more personalized experience for all our consumers.  Yes, we have been listening.  Unfortunately, there were some glitches between the two vendors that were outside our control and it has caused a temporary service break.  We are working to correct as fast as possible and expect a resolution today.  Should you feel like you need to look elsewhere feel free to do so, if you do need assistance feel free to email me directly and we will handle.  -  Henry Glover - henry@rragent.com

name: emily dykes
text: Red Rock was so helpful to me! They set up all my insurance policies for my new home and car with ease. They found me the best prices and took all the work of shopping around for insurance out of my busy hands. I definitely recommend their services! Natalie went out of her way to work extra hard for me for a home with tricky coverage problems. I can't say enough nice things about her or the service she provided me with.

name: Brandon Lee
text: We're gracious to everyone at Red Rock for their kind service and business for the better part of two years. Unfortunately we moved out of the coverage area, in turn forcing us to part ways, but we would highly suggest the company to anyone.

name: Ann Thrash-Trumbo
text: We've been with Red Rock for almost 3 years now.  We've, fortunately, not had a claim in that time.  The service and response time from the office is great, though.  I get real help immediately whenever I phone.

name: lane lovelady
text: This company is complete garbage. Please don't waste your time on their lies. They do nothing you ask them and timely manners mean nothing to them. A handful of times they have ignored what I've asked them to do. Don't waste your time or money.

resp.text: It is sad that you would choose a public forum to complain about a single transaction (not a handful) where you remove your fiance but are belligerent that we would do the ethical thing of informing her of her loss of coverage. Now all of a sudden we are garbage and liars? Do us a favor and don't waste our time with your money :) we will always do what is best for ALL parties of a transaction, even if it gets us a single star review. We sleep pretty good at night... how about you?  By the way, I get a kick out of reading all your 1 star reviews - has any business satisfied you? http://alta.life/LaneLoveladysBADreviews

name: Reid Marshall
text: They do a great job finding the best rates and coverage and are very organized! I have moved all my personal and business insurance to them! Highly recommend!

name: Rachel Andrews
text: I wouldn't even give 1 star if it were an option as I could not get someone at this office to return a phone call. I left 3 messages. They came highly recommend by my loan officer. I guess they do not need new business.

resp.text: Rachel, you called one time (not 3) at 8:22 this morning.  Your case was assigned at 8:33, an agent started working it at 2:14.   You are set up to receive a call back before the end of the day.  So I am a little confused as to why you would write such a negative review.

name: Lance Moore
text: I have been with Red Rock for over four years. I have been extremely pleased with their insurance services. Henry has always been responsive and found the best coverage for the best price.

name: Wen Reagan
text: Great experience with John Lipscomb. Got a great price!

name: Shunte Moore
text: Two or theee years ago, this would have been five stars (honestly would have given it 10 stars if I could have). Unfortunately, at this point in time, I cannot say the same.  The new person that has been assigned to me does not return emails in a timely fashion. And due to this reason, over the past year I've had to pay a higher monthly amount in auto insurance because of the math being divided over a shorter number of months (she dragged her feet getting things done). She gave me apology after apology when I would ask "What's going on??". She was always "so sorry about how long it's taken to get back to me.." But unfortunately, that helps me NONE. I reached out in December 2016 to ask that they let me know if the auto premium would go up so that we could get a start on switching me to different insurance if necessary (in an effort to give them more time to work).  They said I needed to wait closer to the renewal date (Feb 20). I waited and reached out again on Feb 4. I got a response back on Feb 6 that said that they started a "reshop" and would let me know as soon as it was done. It's now Feb 25. Almost 3 weeks later... I've heard nothing. Which doesn't surprise me, but is still unacceptable. It's my understanding that Natalie (who use to handle my business SUPERBLY) is no longer there. Things seem to have gone to crap since. I may be in the market for another broker all together.

resp.text:
Shunte,

We are terribly sorry to hear about your customer service experience. However, Natalie has been gone since 2015 and there have been several of renewal cycles on your account since then.

As a manager at Red Rock, I sincerely wish you would have contacted someone on the management team about your experience. We would have gladly stepped in to ensure your satisfaction and happiness in a timely fashion by providing you with a different agent.

Given the fact that we were not offered an opportunity to correct our problem, your remarks about “going to crap” are harsh, unwarranted, and unfair. Customer satisfaction is a primary goal of our team every day. Your situation would have been a great learning example of how we grow when faced with opportunities to improve.

Please feel free to contact our office for additional assistance.

name: Sarah Brumfield

name: Samaria Walker
text: Real nice and very helpful

name: Lance Hearn
text:
I write this because I am not 100% in line with the response to Shunte Moore. My experience is near identical. I became a RedRock Customer in early 2014, they were great. I gave them a call, provided them with my info, and they came back a day later with the best deals from their contracted carriers. I chose The Hartford. I then had no contact with RR until January of 2016, when i asked if they could "re-shop" my rates. My original agent was gone. Several weeks and additional inquiries later I was told that The Hartford was still the best option for me. Seemed like a long time to have to wait, but everyone gets busy from time to time, no big deal.
Last September, I purchased a new car and contacted RR to have it insured. I also changed coverage on my other cars. The new car was added, the new documents were received, and the automatic insurance payment kept coming out. In mid-November, I receive a notice from my Credit Union stating they had received an insurance cancellation letter on the new car. I contacted The Hartford directly and they confirmed the change had been initiated by RedRock. Apparently, RR had accidentally removed it from my plan completely, the day after it was added... I had been driving around for months without insurance coverage. (Coverage on other vehicles was incorrect as well) I had to backpay 3 months of premiums so that I wouldn't show a gap in coverage. (Robbery, since I would not have been covered had I been in an accident, but that was a Hartford policy that RR had no control over) I called RR and informed them of the situation. They basically respond “Sorry, people make mistakes.” Not being sure they fully comprehended the gravity of the situation, I pressed the issue. I informed them that, unfortunately, I had no ideas to offer so far as a solution to the problem, but considering I could have been financially ruined had I been in an accident with no coverage, a simple “We are sorry” would not suffice. Finally, I was informed that the manager had been notified, was deeply troubled by the situation, and would contact me. (Excellent, surely we will talk and he can apologize for the error and tell me about the failsafes they have implemented to make sure this never happens again) Alas, it has been 7 months and still no contact… I eventually dropped the issue because I don’t have the time (kind of the whole reason I went with RR in the first place.)  They really did just make a mistake. We’ve all made them. Things happen.
Then, a few months ago, I get a letter from The Hartford stating they can not renew my homeowners policy because I am classified as a Fire Protection Class 10 (Too far from fire dept). I call RR and ask them to find me something new. No problem. “It’s Tuesday, give us 48 hrs and we will contact you”. I call back Friday, 72 hrs later. RR: “They are working on it. They have a few rates back and have a presentation scheduled with you for next Tuesday to go over the quotes.”  I respond that there is no need for a presentation. They can email me the rates as they come in. They tell me they will send them over as they get them. In the mean time I have called pretty much every insurance company known to man and gotten quotes within about 3 1/2 minutes. So, the next Tuesday rolls around and, still nothing from RR. I gave them another week or so and never heard anything back. Now, granted I did have a few weeks before my policy ended, I didn't want to wait until the last minute to choose a new company nor did I want to give more money to a company that couldn't offer me coverage in the future. I settled on a new insurance company and called RR to cancel. They did get the cancellation documents to me quickly…
TL;DR: Makes requested policy changes promptly, but with little accuracy. Takes extended amounts of time to respond to general questions and inquiries. They accidentally canceled coverage on one of my cars, so I was driving around for several months with no insurance. Apparently this wasn’t deemed important enough for a manager to contact me. Always verify coverage directly!

resp.text: Lance, you were in a protection class 10 anyone that told you otherwise provided you with inaccurate information, and it is entirely possible that you will be in the same situation again.  I reviewed the notes and work done behind the scene, and there was a lot done to keep your business yet through all attempts by our team to rectify the situation it became apparent that nothing was going to satisfy you.  There are many inaccuracies in your statements and timelines backed by our notes in the system.  The beauty of a free world is you are entitled to your opinion and have every right to post it publicly.  Sad that you are the type of person that would exaggerate in a way such as this.  The beauty of this economy is that you also have every right to do business with whoever you please.  Glad you found something that fits your insurance needs and I wish you the best even though I give your attitude towards the team a single star.
